title: Restore original application format and colour theme

requirements.text: Restore the original visual colour theme across all pages and components, including the navy-blue academic palette defined in frontend/src/index.css and frontend/tailwind.config.js, ensuring no colour tokens, gradients, or theme variables have been altered from the original.

quotes: provide original format of applications...colour theme and all dont change

acceptanceCriteria: All pages render with the original navy-blue academic colour scheme
CSS custom properties in frontend/src/index.css match the original theme tokens
Tailwind config colour palette is unchanged from the original configuration
Dark and light mode colour tokens are intact and functioning

requirements.text: Restore the original layout and formatting of all application pages (Dashboard, Login, QuestionBank, GeneratePaper, GeneratedPapers, PaperPreview, AddQuestion) including sidebar, navigation, cards, typography, spacing, and component structure to match the original design without any visual modifications.

quotes: provide original format of applications...colour theme and all dont change

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar in Layout.tsx renders with original navy-blue styling and navigation items
Dashboard stats cards, workflow diagram, and system overview banner appear in original format
PaperCard, QuestionCard, StatsCard, and all shared components match original visual design
Typography (Poppins/Inter fonts) and spacing are consistent with the original design
No layout shifts, missing styles, or visual regressions compared to original

requirements.text: Restore the original PDF/print generation format in frontend/src/utils/pdfGenerator.ts, ensuring the printable HTML exam paper layout, section labels, question formatting, MCQ option layout, marks display, and instructions all match the original paper format exactly as it was before any modifications.

quotes: provide original format of applications...colour theme and all dont change

acceptanceCriteria: PDF download from PaperPreview produces output in the original paper layout
Exam paper sections, question numbering, and MCQ options render correctly in print view
Paper header with subject, duration, and total marks displays in original format
Print layout does not break or reflow when generating PDF

constraints: Do not change any existing functionality — only restore visual/format elements to original state
Do not modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui
Do not alter backend logic in backend/main.mo
Colour theme must remain navy-blue academic palette — do not introduce new colours
nonGoals: Modifying backend data models or CRUD operations
Introducing a new design system or colour palette
